Initially, detectives suspect a young boy (Johnny Mayhew) who brought his mother's gun to school, but the weapon turns out to be a different caliber. They then arrest an elderly man (Mr. Buggesi) for molesting a witness girl (Maddy), but he was at the dentist during the shooting and did not commit the shooting. The actual shooter is Brannon Lee Redding, a white supremacist skinhead who was given the rifle by Brian Ackerman, leader of a hate group called Revolutionary Aryan Warriors (RAW). The shooting targeted the adopted African-American son of a Rikers corrections officer. Mr. Buggesi is accused publicly and assaulted by Maddy's uncle before being cleared of the shooting (though wanted in Florida for molestation). Johnny Mayhew's mother is arrested for illegal gun possession, publicly exposing the family, though Johnny was never the shooter.

SVU investigates skeletal remains of Juan Alvarez (missing since 1978) found in a quarry, leading to discovery of three more boys from same period and connection to 1970 'boy in the box' cold case. Killer Sheldon Kerrick operated under stolen identity 'Robert Sawyer.' Carlos Guzman provided false alibi under duress but was complicit/coerced accomplice, not falsely accused. Anna Gable was drugged victim/witness who eventually helped solve case. No innocent parties were publicly accused or harmed by false allegations in this episode.

A serial rapist (Mike Jergens) attacks successful women he meets through speed dating. He is arrested, tried, and convicted. His girlfriend Cora provides alibi-breaking testimony, then marries him during trial. She later suffers alcohol poisoning and brain death; Mike removes her feeding tube. No innocent persons are falsely accused in this episode—Mike is guilty and convicted. Cora is a victim, not an accused person. The episode focuses on right-to-die issues rather than false accusation.

A 16-year-old girl and her boyfriend are investigated after she is attacked and loses her baby. The investigation reveals they both participated in attempting to terminate her pregnancy through violent means after being deceived by a fake abortion clinic. The boyfriend is charged but acquitted of felony charges; the doctor running the fake clinic is arrested for fraud and reckless endangerment. No innocent suspects are falsely accused and exposed in this episode.

SVU investigates when three young girls evacuated from Hurricane Katrina are found with a man who abducted them. The man, Alvin Dutch (a registered sex offender), dies from anthrax exposure. The investigation reveals he encountered weaponized anthrax stolen from a Louisiana bioweapons lab by Michael Delpit, who transported it to NYC and sold it to an unknown buyer. Federal agents take over the case, classify all information, and seize evidence. No false accusations of sexual crimes occur in this episode—the actual perpetrator (Dutch) is correctly identified as a sex offender and child abductor, though he dies before prosecution. Michael Delpit is arrested for anthrax theft, not sexual crimes. The episode focuses on bioterrorism rather than wrongful accusation.

8-year-old Emma Boyd stabs classmate Sean Hamill after sustained bullying over her lesbian mothers. Initially, Charlie Monaghan (Emma's half-brother) is suspected after being identified as having beaten Sean a week earlier. Charlie lies to protect Emma. After Emma's arrest, her grandparents accuse her mother Zoe Dunlop of sexual abuse to gain custody, coached by their attorney James Decker. The molestation allegations are proven false—the grandmother manipulated Emma using legitimate massage photos. Both Charlie and Zoe are publicly accused and exposed despite being innocent.

Monica Phelps is raped and murdered; her son Nathan witnesses it from a closet. Ted Carthage, a philanthropist running a charity, is revealed to be paying drug-addicted women (including Monica and her friend Gina Arroyo, both now dead) for sex. He's arrested for statutory rape and suspected of the murders. Nathan attempts a voice lineup but picks the wrong voice. When Nathan later sees Carthage, he shoots and kills him at Carthage's office. The episode focuses on Nathan's murder trial and a legal battle over a plea bargain. No one is falsely accused in this episode—Carthage was guilty of the sex crimes he was charged with, and likely guilty of the murders (though never proven in court because Nathan killed him first).

Eight-year-old Carly Hunter is kidnapped for ransom. Police initially pursue Joel Mayder, a registered sex offender on parole who was previously caught near Carly's school. Mayder flees rooftop pursuit and jumps to his death. Investigation reveals kidnapper is actually Carly's estranged cocaine-addicted brother Daniel, seeking ransom money to pay drug debts. Joel Mayder qualifies as falsely accused with public exposure (parole officer present, apartment search) and fatal consequence directly resulting from the accusation/pursuit.

Episode centers on Ella Christensen, found to have abandoned her newborn. Investigation reveals she's a victim of incestuous rape by her father, Councilman Everett Drake. The main suspect falsely accused is Varla, a homeless woman suffering from pseudocyesis (phantom pregnancy), who is publicly confronted. Jerry Spencer, Drake's campaign manager, is also briefly suspected and threatened with paternity testing before being cleared. Ella is found not guilty by reason of insanity; Drake evades accountability despite being the true perpetrator.

A murdered model named Natalie Bleers is found killed by a tiger bite, leading SVU to investigate an exotic animal smuggling operation run by Andre Bushido and Victor Tybor. Detective Stabler goes undercover as a corrupt customs agent to infiltrate the ring. During the operation, Bushido becomes suspicious and shoots Stabler, but Stabler survives. The episode culminates in the arrest of Bushido, Tybor, and their associates. The case involves murder, animal smuggling, and organized crime, but does not feature false accusations of sexual crimes or innocent people harmed by such accusations.

Canadian high school student Jennifer Durning disappears after being raped. Three boys (Nick Pratt, Doug Waverly, Jason King) are arrested. Jason cooperates and testifies against Nick and Doug, identifying them as the rapists/murderers. Jason is then kidnapped (likely by Nick/Doug via corrupt court officer Emily McCooper who bugged judge's chambers). The case collapses without Jason's testimony; Nick and Doug are released. No persons wrongly accused of the primary crime are identified in this episode—Jason cooperated voluntarily and was not proven innocent of participation; Nick and Doug are implied guilty throughout. The episode ends with the search for the missing witness Jason, not a false accusation storyline.

College student Caroline Pereira is murdered. Initial investigation leads detectives to football player Roddy Franklin, who is questioned about his connection to Caroline and publicly confronted before being cleared. Franklin lost his expensive ring to Caroline in a poker game and was trying to get it back, but did not kill her. The actual killer is Adam Halder, Caroline's childhood friend and poker partner, who strangled her to avoid a gambling debt.

Ken Randall, a college student and son of Detective Fin Tutuola, is arrested for digging in a vacant lot looking for a body after overhearing a murder confession at a bar. He is publicly accused and investigated for a double homicide (Nina Stansfield and her toddler son). Ken is eventually cleared when DNA testing reveals his half-brother Darius Parker is the actual killer. Ken was protecting Darius throughout. Ken suffers public exposure through arrest, investigation by SVU in front of his mother and attorney, and workplace/family reputation damage. Steven Stansfield, the victim's husband, was also a long-term suspect who endured years of public suspicion, job/social ostracization, and ongoing investigation despite his innocence.

Victor Paul Gitano, a registered sex offender who skipped bail in Pennsylvania, murders Simon Clifford, Lyla Clifford, and Amy Clifford (16), then kidnaps Ryan (9) and Rebecca (7). The episode focuses on the manhunt for Gitano and the rescue attempts. Ryan is killed during a confrontation at a bus terminal; Rebecca is rescued alive. No innocent suspects are accused or publicly exposed; the investigation correctly identifies Gitano from the start based on his prior offense at the school and physical evidence.

Jessica Delay falsely reports being kidnapped and sexually assaulted by Mia and Kenny Bixton. In reality, Jessica and Tommy Strahan had brutally assaulted the siblings' brother Rudi Bixton in a hate crime weeks earlier. Mia and Kenny retaliated against Jessica. Hamzid Latif, a store owner who had sold cigarettes to Jessica during a sting operation, was also briefly suspected. Jessica's false accusation led to the Bixton siblings being arrested and jailed, while her role as perpetrator in the original assault went uninvestigated until political pressure forced police to examine Rudi's case.

Episode involves a child abuse case where Jake Winnock is initially believed to have been abused by his father Gregory Hensal (convicted sex offender). Investigation reveals Jake was actually abused by his older brother Teddy, who was running a child pornography website. Gregory Hensal is falsely accused and publicly exposed before being cleared. Episode centers on Teddy's exploitation by online predophiles and eventual rescue.

Jamie Hoskins, a bipolar teenager who stopped taking her medication after influence from rock star Derek Lord, accuses two male classmates (Danny Morrison and Cameron Shaw) of rape after consensual group sex in a school bathroom. She later recants when confronted with video evidence showing she initiated the encounter. Both boys are expelled from school despite being innocent. Jamie subsequently causes a car accident while in a manic episode, killing one person. The episode focuses on Derek Lord's anti-psychiatry crusade and its consequences.

Haley Kerns is raped by Zander Owens, who shaved her head as punishment for informing on him 5 years earlier. Initially, eco-activist Mitchell Hissam is suspected due to his extremist activities and relationship with Haley. Mitchell is questioned, his cabin searched (leading to dynamite discovery and Detective Stabler's injury), and his girlfriend Persephone is leveraged for information. DNA eventually identifies the actual rapist as Zander Owens. Mitchell was never publicly accused of rape, only questioned privately by police/FBI. No public exposure of Mitchell as a rape suspect occurred - questioning happened in police interview rooms and his cabin. The investigation remained confidential.

Episode focuses on a missing 17-year-old girl with Turner Syndrome who ran away to be with a 30-year-old man. Connor Wesley staged a fake kidnapping for money but was not actually kidnapped. Greg Hartley, the man Janey ran away with, is arrested but the relationship appears consensual under law. No person is proven or strongly implied innocent of sexual crimes they were accused of. Connor faked his own kidnapping (not innocent of fabrication). Greg Hartley is accused of rape but evidence shows consensual relationship with legal-age person; he's not cleared of wrongdoing, just not prosecutable. Nathan Speer suspected of custodial interference but never formally accused or cleared.

Episode involves two instances of false accusation: (1) Barry Cole arrested for rape of Nikki West based on misinterpreted fingerprint evidence, then released when correct suspect (Martin Trenway) identified; (2) Heather Stark identifies Martin Trenway from newspaper photo as her rapist from 5 years prior, but DNA proves Trenway did NOT rape Stark (though he did rape Nikki West and confessed to other crimes). Barry Cole experiences public exposure through media coverage of his arrest.

Gabriella Travino and her 10-year-old daughter Illaria are raped, tortured, and murdered. Detectives initially investigate Andrew Munch (Detective Munch's uncle), a homeless man with severe depression who had been befriended by the children and was found with blood on his hands and a collection of sex crime clippings. He is cleared when the real perpetrator, Brent Allen Banks (a convicted sex offender), is identified through fingerprints and bite marks. Banks' indictment is thrown out on a technicality. In a manic episode triggered by antidepressants, Andrew Munch pushes Banks in front of a subway train, killing him. Andrew Munch was innocent of the rape-murders but became responsible for the vigilante killing.

Serial rapist Luke Dixon rapes women multiple times using ovulation tracking. Ted Wilmington is initially suspected as property manager but cleared via DNA. Megan Carlisle is publicly forced to reveal pregnancy via rape through compelled amniocentesis. Barry Carlisle confronted with wife's rape-pregnancy in workplace-adjacent setting. Episode shows harm from police pressure tactics and public exposure of rape victims.

Episode involves two distinct false accusation threads: (1) Olivia Benson accused in court of planting evidence (chewing gum) to frame Peter Lophus for rape of Chelsea Arndale - defense claims she had revenge motive from prior arrest; (2) Environmental activist group suspected of murdering Carl Dunford when actual killer was his long-term child abduction/rape victim Britney Dunlap acting in response to captivity. The environmental group (including undercover Olivia as 'Persephone' and activist T-bone) faced public suspicion and police pressure despite being innocent of the homicide.

Three teenage prostitutes with matching tattoos are found murdered. Investigation initially focuses on Blake Peters, a wealthy lawyer who paid for sex with underage girls. Detectives publicly confront Peters at a motel, arrest him in front of a college student he was with, and interrogate him for the murders. Peters admits to soliciting minors but denies murder, claiming the girls' pimp Victor Bodine threatened him. Investigation shifts to Bodine, who is ultimately revealed as the killer. Peters is innocent of murder but guilty of statutory rape.

SVU investigates children handcuffed in a van that crashed into a river. They discover a network of abusive foster/adoption homes using rebirthing therapy. A girl named Rose dies from suffocation during therapy. Frank Hovis (van driver) is accused of endangering the children but was actually hired transport. Dr. Arlen Rieff provided phone consultation for the deadly therapy session. The real perpetrators (Bud and Rita Gabler) receive only 2 years for criminally negligent homicide. Frank is publicly accused by detectives at his mother's home in front of her and neighbors despite being innocent of abuse—he actually saved the children from drowning.

Danielle Masoner is found dying in Central Park. Initially believed to be rape/heart attack, ME determines she was poisoned with dieldrin. Her husband Wesley Masoner becomes the prime suspect due to an affair with dancer Naomi Cheales. Evidence (poison vial, shipping receipt, gloves) found at his loft. Wesley is arrested and charged with murder. However, Naomi's husband Glenn Cheales confesses to killing Danielle to frame Wesley for taking his wife. Glenn had been tracking Naomi with an implanted RFID chip. Wesley was innocent but publicly accused, arrested, and charged before the real killer confessed.

Mike Mollinax was wrongfully convicted in 1972 for murdering his ex-wife Suzanne Mollinax and their baby in an arson fire. He served 34 years in prison before being exonerated by Jud Tierney's deathbed confession. Tierney revealed that his partner Jack Colino actually killed Suzanne when she threatened to expose their bank robberies, and Tierney then killed Colino to save the baby (Sheila). Mollinax's conviction was based solely on motive (prior threats while drunk) and circumstantial evidence. While in prison, Mollinax killed another inmate in self-defense during a race riot, complicating his release. He was ultimately pardoned by the governor on condition of pleading guilty to the prison murder with time served.

Six-year-old Theo Lachere goes missing after his mother Nadine throws a party. SVU investigates multiple suspects including Nadine's ex-boyfriend Gabriel Norton and eventually discovers the nanny Gloria Ramirez orchestrated the 'kidnapping' to take Theo to Mexico because she believed he wasn't safe with Nadine. Gabriel Norton is wrongly accused, publicly arrested, detained on weapons charges as leverage, and subjected to threatening interrogation tactics despite being innocent of the kidnapping.

Henry Chanoor, a janitor and son of a prominent doctor, commits multiple rapes and murders seeking fame and his father's approval. Dr. Rankesh Chanoor is initially arrested as the suspect based on his connections to all victims through his medical practice. Oliver Mitsakos, Kara Bawson's ex-fiancé, is also questioned as a suspect. Both are later cleared when evidence points to Henry Chanoor, who kept a scrapbook celebrating the media coverage of his crimes.

SVU receives anonymous child porn photos of Diego Benitez. They arrest building super Seth Millstead for possession. Investigation reveals photos were actually documentation of illegal human pesticide testing on poor families, including Diego. Millstead is murdered in Rikers before trial. Detective Benson and 11 others are poisoned during investigation. Diego develops follicular lymphoma. Chemical company Danforth uses legal loopholes to avoid accountability. Episode ends with detectives preparing to illegally hack Danforth to obtain evidence.

Maura Truex is murdered and her husband Sidney assaulted. Daughter Charlotte is accused after Sidney identifies her and evidence (bloody shoe, confession) appears to implicate her. Later, sodium amytal interview reveals boyfriend Ryan Bedford committed the murder while high on drugs. Charlotte is cleared. Ryan dies during arrest; Elliot is investigated for his death but cleared when autopsy shows Ryan had undiagnosed long QT syndrome that caused cardiac arrest during the chase.

Baby Kendall is reported kidnapped. Laura Kozlowski accuses her ex-husband Dan of taking the child. SVU initially suspects Laura herself killed the baby. Both Dan and Laura are publicly exposed as suspects. Dan is chased by police and interrogated. Laura is ambushed by a reporter on live TV, accused of killing her son, leading to her suicide. The baby is later found alive. The actual kidnapper was James 'Paddy' Kendall, the biological father and Laura's abusive ex-boyfriend.

Olivia discovers Simon Marsden is her half-brother (same father who raped her mother). Riverpark Captain Julia Millfield accuses Simon of stalking 3 women and raping Donna Leonte. Simon claims innocence and that Millfield is framing him because of a high school incident with her sister Carrie (he tore her dress during a date). DNA evidence (hair on victim's panties) matches Simon. Episode ends with Simon jumping bail. Multiple male rape victims (Ronnie, Qinawi, others) refuse to cooperate in separate Central Park case. Strong evidence of police bias/persecution by Millfield due to personal grudge.

A male prostitute is murdered. Reverend Jeb Curtis is arrested after confessing under psychological coercion in his church. Evidence suggests Curtis paid the victim's rent and his DNA was found at the scene. Curtis' wife Hannah shoots him believing he murdered the victim. It's ultimately revealed that Curtis' son Paul was in a relationship with the victim, and church financial director Trent Labette committed the murder. Curtis falsely confessed to protect his son, and Hannah shot him believing he was guilty.

Episode centers on underage drinking and a death at a house party. No false accusations of sex crimes are present. The primary investigation involves Melanie Tamkin's alcohol-related death at a party. Lillian Rice is accused and charged with providing alcohol to minors (including her daughter Becca and Jordan Owens) and statutory rape of Jordan. Jordan's voluntary participation and statements that he 'wanted it' and 'loves her' indicate consensual relationship (albeit illegal due to age/alcohol). No one is falsely accused then proven innocent. The case involves actual criminal conduct (statutory rape, contributing to the delinquency of minors). Episode does not meet criteria for inclusion in false accusation dataset.

Simon Marsden, Olivia Benson's half-brother, is accused of rape and stalking. Captain Julia Millfield from New Jersey framed him by planting his hair as evidence. The actual rape victim, Donna Leonte, was coached to falsely identify Simon in a lineup. Simon is ultimately proven innocent when Millfield confesses she fabricated evidence to punish him for allegedly assaulting her sister Carrie years earlier. The episode reveals Simon's only actual misconduct was attempting to kiss Carrie in high school, which triggered her PTSD from being molested by her own father. Simon was never publicly exposed or formally sanctioned before being cleared.

Malcolm Royce, a convention planner, murdered his girlfriend Cynthia Yellin and his three children, then shot himself to make it look like his wife Lindsay killed the family. He had falsely claimed to be a CIA agent named Steven Dashiell to maintain his affair. The episode focuses on the detectives uncovering Royce as the perpetrator. No innocent person was wrongly accused with public exposure or material harm. The initial terrorism angle was investigative speculation, not a formal accusation of any specific person. Malcolm Royce is the perpetrator throughout.

A teenage boy is killed in what appears to be an S&M gone wrong. Detectives and the community initially suspect Darren Tolson, a registered sex offender, and a grieving mother identifies the victim as her missing son Joey. The case unravels when the actual victim is identified as Riley Cuskey, killed accidentally by his friend Scott Heston during extreme wrestling. Later, 'Cassandra Sullivan,' believed to be a 16-year-old student and Riley's girlfriend, is discovered to be a 28-year-old woman who has been fraudulently re-entering foster care and high school for over a decade.

This episode centers on the murder trial of Darius Parker (Fin's stepson), not a false accusation case. The trial revolves around a real murder where the defendant is acquitted due to suppressed evidence (illegal confession), not innocence. Defense attorney Matt Braden attacks SVU detectives' credibility (Fin's evidence handling, Stabler's daughter's DUI cover-up) to create reasonable doubt. No innocent person is falsely accused in this episode - it's about a guilty defendant exploiting procedural errors and police misconduct to avoid conviction. The detectives are professionally damaged but this doesn't meet the project's criteria of tracking innocent people harmed by false sex crime accusations.

Janis Donovan reports herself to SVU posing as 'Dr. Anna Young' claiming concern about child abuse. Investigation reveals Janis has dissociative identity disorder (DID) with multiple personalities. After Janis is arrested for murdering her abusive parents, her defense claims an alter personality (Burt) committed the murders without her knowledge. She is found not guilty by reason of insanity. Later revealed Janis and her sister Cass planned the murders and faked the DID based on research done while Cass was in prison. Both are guilty. No innocent suspects were harmed.

Two men (Tobin Willis and Nestor Buchanan) are accused and publicly exposed as suspects in Rachel McGarrett's kidnapping and rape. Both are later proven innocent when detectives discover the real perpetrator is Julian Cooper/Gregory Searle, who framed them by stealing Willis's credit card to create an avatar account and using his employee Nestor's game participation to make them appear as partners. Both men suffer workplace and public exposure as a result of the false accusations.

High school teacher Sarah Trent is arrested for statutory rape after 15-year-old student Shane Mills tells his pediatrician they had sex. Sarah claims Shane raped her. SVU arrests Sarah in front of her entire class. Investigation reveals Shane hired prostitutes to practice a rape scenario, fabricated evidence against Sarah, and contracted gonorrhea from a prostitute (not Sarah). Shane ultimately confesses to raping Sarah but claims sex addiction made him unable to control himself. He receives probation and treatment instead of prison, then is himself raped at the treatment facility by a predator posing as a guard.

Karin Nicholson is raped and beaten into a coma. Her husband Ben becomes the prime suspect, but FBI protects him due to homeland security investigation. Joel Parven (the actual rapist) is initially suspected but cleared. His son Alex Parven is eventually identified as the attacker who beat Karin (not the rapist). Ben Nicholson is publicly treated as suspect despite being innocent of the attack. Joel Parven is publicly accused of rape/attack before being cleared.

College counselor Kate Simes is murdered in Central Park. Investigation reveals she was helping Haroun Abbas (Iraqi torture survivor) write a tell-all memoir about his detention/torture by US contractor Helios Defense. Abbas dies of hypothermia-induced cardiac arrest (torture method). George Tomforde (Helios interrogator) identified as prime suspect; company whisks him to Bahrain before arrest. Dr. Faith Sutton (psychiatrist who designed 'torture lite' methods) charged with criminally negligent homicide for Abbas's death. Case ends in mistrial after Sutton saves juror's life in courtroom; she faces medical license suspension. Jackie Solomon falsely implicated early as suspect due to conflict with Kate over racist video.

College student Tina Snow is murdered in a crime staged to resemble artwork by imprisoned serial killer Robert Morten. Bartender Cecilia Strayer is kidnapped and wounded in a second attack. Investigation reveals Cecilia was manipulated by Morten into committing the murders. Edgar Rabinowicz (Agent Mayhem) and Jasper Grice are wrongly accused before the true perpetrator is identified. Harrison Thomas is falsely suspected of bombing the precinct.

Saul Picard, a children's book author with schizophrenia, kidnaps and rapes three girls (Sabrina Farmer, Eve Holland, and Tiffany Lemarsh) while experiencing psychotic delusions that they are his sister Francine, who was gang-raped when he was 17. He believes he is saving them from rapists. Picard is the actual perpetrator—his psychotic state explains his behavior but does not make him a false suspect. No innocent persons are accused or harmed by false accusations in this episode. Detective Stabler is injured during Picard's arrest, sustaining temporary blindness, but this is an occupational hazard unrelated to false accusation. The episode focuses on the ethics of prosecuting a mentally ill defendant and whether Louisiana should execute him.

Julie Donovan (17) is found murdered. DNA initially points to MMA fighter Mike Kona, who has alibi. Victim's father Terry Donovan shoots and kills Kona at SVU. Investigation reveals brothers Jadon and Ezra Odami were at party with victim. Jadon falsely confesses to murder to protect brother Ezra (who he believes guilty). Detective Lake discovers gang leader Jimmy Mac (McDonnell) actually killed Julie as punishment when she refused to falsely accuse the Odami brothers of rape as part of blackmail scheme. Both brothers cleared and returned to college.

A young boy found with blood on his clothes leads SVU to discover his nanny has been murdered. The investigation reveals the nanny, Jodi Simmons, had been meeting men through Faceunion dating site. Rafael Gardiner is arrested and confesses to killing Jodi after she rejected him. The case also uncovers that Jake Keegan is not Tommy's biological father. Jake later murders his wife Leah when she files for divorce and the biological father files for custody. Episode concludes with Kathy Stabler giving birth after a serious car accident.

15-year-old Nikkiel Kwambe found dead in East River. Jesse Bleyer initially suspected after epileptic seizure led to false confession and physical evidence misinterpretation. Chukwei Bothame (Nikki's husband and witness in Dennis King murder trial) suspected after running from police. Both proven innocent. Actual killer: Sarah Flint (Chukwei's first wife), who killed Nikki in jealous rage and staged it to look like King's intimidation. Jesse exposed during interrogation; Chukwei publicly accused at home by detectives in front of family and during investigation.

Episode centers on murder of debutante Shelby Crawford in Central Park. Initial investigation focuses on boyfriend Doug Walshen and friend Anna as jealous suspects. Both are interrogated aggressively and publicly accused. Eventually revealed the killer was homeless street family leader Cole Roderick, manipulated by Cassidy Cornell (a runaway from privilege using alias) who lied that Shelby disrespected him. Doug and Anna were innocent but subjected to hostile interrogation and public exposure of their sexual relationship.

FBI profiler Lauren Cooper tracks and executes serial killer Larry Moore (the Woodsman) who tortured and murdered 24 women. SVU investigates Cooper for murder. Conner Robb, who ran a foraging program in Central Park that victim Kate Barrow attended, is briefly questioned but cleared when Moore is identified as the killer. Episode focuses on Cooper's vigilante justice and the ethical dilemma of prosecuting someone who killed a serial killer, not on false accusations.

A 10-year-old boy is found bleeding after being raped. Detectives initially suspect his Hasidic tutor Jacob Ribowsky, confronting him in front of his religious community and school. Jacob is publicly accused and defended by community leaders issuing statements about his innocence before any investigation. He later reveals he has an alibi (was at movies with girlfriend) but couldn't say so initially because it would violate community norms. The actual perpetrator is revealed to be a 14-year-old classmate. Jacob and his girlfriend were both publicly exposed and humiliated to protect their secret relationship.

SVU investigates the theft of frozen embryos from a fertility clinic. James and Victoria Grall from the Values Defense League steal the embryos for publicity to promote embryo adoption, but the embryos die when shipping is delayed. James Grall is murdered at a press conference by Scott Ryland, whose wife Kelly stored eggs before deploying to Iraq where she was killed. No false sexual assault accusations occur in this episode—the case centers on embryo theft and murder.

A 16-year-old foster girl, Ashley Tyler, is raped. Initial investigation focuses on innocent suspects (gardener Cyrus Stewarts, foster father, uncle Rick Tyler). The real perpetrator is prison guard Lowell Harris, who had been raping Ashley's incarcerated mother Risa and later murdered her when she stopped supplying drugs. Detective Benson goes undercover at Sealview prison to catch Harris. Multiple innocent people are publicly accused/confronted before the real rapist is identified.

Jeremy Haines, a business manager, is found murdered. Lincoln Haver, a closeted NFL quarterback and Jeremy's secret husband, becomes the prime suspect. Lincoln is publicly outed as gay, arrested, charged with murder, and convicted. The actual killer is revealed to be Gary Lesley, Lincoln's agent, who murdered Jeremy to prevent Lincoln from coming out and retiring, which would have cost Gary millions in commissions. Lincoln's life is destroyed by the false accusation: he is publicly outed, gay-bashed and nearly killed, arrested on live TV, convicted of murder, and loses his career due to brain damage from the hate crime beating.

Merritt Rook impersonates a police detective to manipulate HappiBurger manager Dwight Lomax into strip-searching employee Trini Martinez. Lomax is arrested for sexual abuse but is later revealed to be a victim of Rook's phone scam. Dr. Francis Slifkin was also targeted by Rook (posing as Detective Milgram) in harassing calls that drove him to suicide. Both Lomax and Slifkin were innocent of the crimes initially suspected but manipulated/coerced into harmful actions or outcomes by Rook's impersonation scheme.

Jenna Ludlow is murdered and her apartment set on fire. Initially PJ Bartlett (fiancé) is suspected, then both PJ and his father Pierson Bartlett Sr. are accused of conspiracy. DNA evidence reveals Pierson Sr. fathered Jenna's baby, not PJ. PJ is publicly accused at police station, then charges pivot to his father. Both are accused in front of each other and legal counsel. The case involves false pregnancy claims, blackmail over business secrets, and jury tampering. Multiple false accusations occur with shifting theories throughout investigation.

Miguel Pinto is falsely accused of Ana Machado's rape/murder after Lt. Paul Gomez plants Pinto's DNA (stolen via sex worker collecting used condom). Squad initially pursues Pinto; alibi clears him. Father Alberto flees/dies during confrontation, initially suspected but later understood as victim of Gomez's threats. Gomez ultimately revealed as serial rapist/killer targeting shelter women.

Christopher Ryan, a 7-year-old foster child, steals a van to escape his foster parents. Investigation reveals he was enrolled in drug trials without proper consent. The case expands to uncover Noah Sibert, the foster father, as a serial rapist who raped his own wife Gwen 5 years prior (she didn't know it was him) and then three other single mothers. Henry, a bartender, is initially investigated as a suspect based on his connection to victim Emily Johannes and his documented behavior of obtaining women's addresses. He is cleared through voice line-up. Episode ends with Olivia seeking therapy for her own sexual assault trauma.

Eric Byers, a 17-year-old, walks into SVU claiming pedophilic urges toward his 5-year-old stepbrother Cory but insisting he never acted on them. Cory's father Sean Kelley is revealed to have sodomized Eric with a baseball bat in vigilante revenge, believing Eric molested Cory. Physical exam shows no evidence of sexual abuse. Eric is later murdered by Jake Berlin, a pedophile advocate website operator, after Eric confessed online to molesting an unidentified child (victim never found/confirmed). Sean Kelley is falsely accused of Eric's murder but didn't commit it. The episode tracks multiple layers of accusation, including the initial unproven accusation against Eric.

This episode focuses on Detective Stabler's daughter Kathleen, who breaks into a home while under the influence and is accused of theft. She is arrested and charged with burglary and grand larceny. The episode reveals she has bipolar disorder and needs treatment rather than incarceration. While Kathleen is publicly accused and arrested, she is ultimately found guilty (not innocent) as she did commit the acts. The episode explores mental illness, family dynamics, and the criminal justice system's handling of defendants with psychiatric conditions. No false accusations or innocent persons wrongly exposed occur in this episode.

A murdered astronaut case leads SVU to pursue multiple suspects including a serial cab rapist, a mentally ill obsessed fan, and a drug-addicted thief before discovering the true killer was a legendary astronaut. Multiple innocent people were publicly accused or detained during the investigation.

This episode does not feature any person who is falsely accused of a sex crime and later cleared. Dr. Gideon Hutton is accused of criminally negligent homicide (medical malpractice/murder), not a sex crime. He is guilty of his charges. Susan Ross is charged with murdering her daughter through medical neglect; she is guilty. No qualifying person-rows exist for this episode.

Joshua Galli, a homeless man with schizophrenia, is castrated and burned alive by Alec Bernardi, who mistakenly believed Josh raped his sister Tina. In reality, Tina had consensual sex with Josh as part of a pregnancy pact with friends. Josh was innocent of rape. The episode also involves the Street Cleaners (Seth and Sara), who are initially suspected of Josh's murder but are proven innocent via alibi. The main harm narrative centers on Josh Galli being falsely accused of rape by Alec's misunderstanding, leading to his brutal murder.

A murdered model named Natalie Bleers is found killed by a tiger. Detectives initially suspect Gots Money, a wannabe rapper who owned a tiger and had dated Natalie. He is arrested and interrogated but later cleared when DNA proves his tiger didn't kill her. The real killers are animal smugglers Bushido and Tybor. Gots Money is subsequently murdered by the smugglers using hyenas. Detective Stabler goes undercover as a corrupt Customs agent and is shot by the smugglers but survives.

Mia initially files false stranger rape report to hide spousal abuse, then recants. She is later murdered by her husband Brent Latimer. Historical case: Caroline Cresswell (now Linnie Malcolm) convicted of murdering husband Vincent in 1974; episode reveals she was actually a battered woman acting in self-defense. A pharmacist is briefly accused of assault by Mia but this is resolved quickly without formal charges or significant public exposure beyond the immediate incident.

A pregnant AWOL Marine, Jessica Crewes, is murdered and her unborn baby cut from her womb. Master Sergeant Dominic Pruitt is initially accused based on his prior relationship with the victim and witness identification. He is publicly arrested and held in custody before DNA evidence exonerates him. The actual perpetrator is revealed to be Lieutenant Gary Rosten (the victim's rapist and father of the baby) with help from his wife Marlene. Pruitt endured public accusation, arrest, detention, and an Article 32 military hearing before being cleared.

Eric Lutz is a serial rapist who drugs women with scopolamine (Colombian Devil's Breath) to make them compliant and erase their memories. He videotapes the assaults. Multiple victims are identified: Kelly Sun (travel writer/courier), Laurel Andrews (gym member), Denise (escort), and Shannon Browning (former fiancée). Lutz is arrested and claims a pornography addiction defense. All suspects in this episode are ultimately proven guilty - there are no falsely accused innocent persons who meet the criteria for inclusion in person_rows.

A girl claiming to be Heather Hallander, missing for 4 years, returns home with a story of being held as a sex slave. Investigation reveals she is actually Kristen Vucelik, who was genuinely held captive by her father Carl Vasko/Vucelik for 6 years and escaped by assuming Heather's identity. The real Heather was killed years earlier by her sister Nikki. No innocent persons were falsely accused with public exposure or material harm.

Episode involves multiple false suspects investigated for the murder of 14-year-old genius student Elsa Lychkoff. Initial suspects include a sex trafficker (Alik), Elsa's abusive father (Joseph Lychkoff), and several troubled Morewood School students. All were cleared. The actual killer was Elsa's roommate Jennifer Banks, who killed due to jealousy and sleep-deprivation psychosis from Provigil abuse. False suspects were questioned but exposure remained largely police-only with no significant public harm shown on-screen.

Rosie Renaldi is kidnapped from her home. Detectives initially suspect her biological father Geno Parnell (ex-con with rape/kidnapping record) due to stalking photos and parole violation. Geno is publicly accused and interrogated. He is later proven innocent when the real kidnapper (Jake, a safecracker) is found—Jake took Rosie as leverage because Frank Hager lost jewels from a heist. Geno faces public exposure during workplace questioning and experiences coercive interrogation tactics.

A repo man (Mark Van Kuren) is brutally beaten outside a strip club. Initial investigation focuses on strippers and then Mark's 13-year-old transgender daughter Hailey, who confesses to protect her guidance counselor Jackie Blaine. Hailey is ultimately cleared via alibi (she was at a warehouse robbery with an activist group). Jackie Blaine, who is also a transgender woman, attacked Mark because he refused to allow Hailey hormone blockers and Jackie believed she was saving Hailey from abuse. Jackie pleads guilty and is sentenced to 8 years. Hailey is never publicly exposed as a suspect beyond family/counselor circle.

Teacher Kevin Sammers is falsely accused of child abuse by student Justin McTeague (who later truthfully accuses Dr. Keppler). SVU interrogates Sammers for 18 hours; though he proves his innocence, his teaching career is destroyed by workplace exposure. Jeffrey Lynwood, a developmentally disabled victim of Dr. Keppler's abuse and undiagnosed lead poisoning, murders Keppler and is arrested/tried. His father Clive is briefly arrested for the murder based on partial DNA match. The episode reveals institutional failures: Denslow Hospital covered up Keppler's abuse, and Keppler failed to diagnose Jeffrey's lead poisoning, which contributed to his developmental disabilities and violent reaction.

Tisa Flores and Alejandro Reyes are found murdered in what initially appears to be a murder-suicide. Investigation reveals a third party. Efraim, an Orthodox Jewish customer at the taxi dance club where Tisa worked, is suspected due to his obsession with her, but is cleared via ear print evidence. The real killer is identified as Marv Sulloway (landlord) via ear print and DNA match. Before SVU can arrest him, Marv is found dead—apparently a suicide. Investigation reveals his wife Birdie drugged and pushed him out a window. Birdie ultimately confesses to killing Marv and four previous husbands over 40 years, with assistance from Chet (her companion/lover). Episode focuses on Birdie as serial killer; the false suspect angle centers on Efraim.

Miriam, a refugee girl from Uganda, is found with her throat slashed. Investigation initially focuses on Elijah Okello, a former child soldier befriended with Miriam, but he is revealed to be innocent. The true perpetrator is Joseph Serumaga (aka 'the Devil of Gulu'), a war criminal who held Miriam as a sex slave for three years before she escaped to a refugee camp. Elijah is wrongly suspected of the attack on Miriam and later faces deportation despite being a victim of forced child soldiering. He ultimately dies by suicide-by-cop while in sanctuary at St. Adrian's Church. The episode explores wrongful suspicion against Elijah and systemic harm from Immigration authorities treating him as a war criminal rather than a victim.

SVU investigates a serial killer targeting women in Harlem and surrounding areas. After a witness description leads to Stefan Henriques, he is arrested and confesses under coercive interrogation. However, another murder occurs while Stefan is in custody, proving his innocence. The actual killer is Mark Ocurro, an airline baggage delivery man. Stefan's exposure was limited to police custody and his confession was coerced through physical intimidation and threats about prison rape.

Ashlee Walker's daughter Sierra dies from measles. Ashlee initially claims a babysitter 'Maria' kidnapped Sierra, sending detectives on a wild goose chase. Evidence points to Ashlee killing Sierra. She is arrested for murder, publicly exposed, and coerced into confessing to spanking Sierra to death. The confession is false—Sierra actually died from measles contracted from an unvaccinated child. Monica Stewart, whose unvaccinated son spread measles, is arrested for murder but acquitted. Ashlee was publicly accused, arrested, and humiliated based on false theories before the true cause of death was revealed.

15-year-old Kim Garnet hospitalized with head injury and pattern of abuse. Detectives initially suspect father Bill (unemployed, stressed), then boyfriend Steve Walker, then friend Ethan Morse. Both Steve and Ethan publicly accused/confronted. Kim eventually reveals Steve was her abuser. Episode also features Judge Marsden wrongfully convicting Kim and shipping her to private Ohio facility as part of kickback scheme. Multiple innocent people publicly accused and harmed.

Owen Walters is accused of raping Pam Galliano after breaking into her apartment. He claims he was set up through a fantasy rape website by someone who had access to Pam's computer and details about her apartment. Investigation reveals Pam's ex-boyfriend Tyler Brunson orchestrated the rape by creating fake profiles and luring Owen. Owen is arrested and charged with rape despite being deceived into believing Pam consented to the encounter. The episode later reveals Tyler is actually the kidnapped son of Judge Koehler, leading to a separate violent confrontation.

Rachel Nauss is murdered in Central Park. Peter Harrison, a paranoid schizophrenic with persecutory delusions, is arrested and charged based on DNA evidence. Due to CSU tech Dale Stuckey's paperwork error co-mingling evidence vouchers, the case is dismissed and Harrison walks free. A second murder occurs (Annie May Lawson at Coney Island), Harrison's attorney Julia Zimmer is killed in a car bomb, and Judge Donnelly is nearly killed with potassium chloride injection. Eventually it's revealed that Stuckey himself committed the second murder and the attacks on Zimmer and Donnelly to frame Harrison and cover his initial mistake. Harrison, though mentally ill and dangerous, is innocent of the crimes attributed to him after his release.

A series of rapes leads detectives to Mark Foster, who is arrested based on victim identification. Meanwhile, they discover that Victor Tate has been wrongfully imprisoned for 10 years for a rape he didn't commit - a rape actually committed by Foster. When Foster dies (falls/jumps from a window while in custody), his confession becomes inadmissible, leaving Tate unable to be freed despite his innocence being proven. The episode also involves Detective Nate Kendall, who demonstrates aggressive interrogation tactics throughout.

Emily Keefe is found murdered in a suitcase dumped from a train. Investigation focuses on her sugar daddy Vance Shepard, CEO of a web company. Shepard is arrested and confesses, but it's revealed his teenage daughter Chantel killed Emily in a rage. Vance covered for her, staging the scene and having Chantel impersonate Emily on the train. When the truth comes out, Chantel fatally stabs Vance in the squad room.

Callum Donovan, a recently paroled ex-con, is accused of kidnapping and sexually assaulting his upstairs neighbor Lily Milton when she goes missing and her apartment shows signs of violent struggle. Detectives Stabler and Benson pursue Donovan based on prior peeping/threat complaints from Lily and boyfriend Parker Hubbard. Lily is found in the Hudson River and initially claims Donovan abducted her. Investigation reveals Lily fabricated the entire crime to hide her crystal meth habit from her boyfriend - she trashed her own apartment during a drug-seeking episode and jumped in the river to maintain the deception. Donovan is cleared of all sex crime accusations but subsequently throws Stabler off a roof when confronted, leading to attempted murder conviction. Episode explores Donovan's 14-year solitary confinement experience as context for his violent reaction to potential reincarceration.

Dalton Rindell is accused of murdering Dr. Audrey Hale, an abortion provider, after hooking up with her at a bar. He claims alcoholic blackout and no memory of events. Evidence strongly supports his guilt (his DNA, bloody prints, bartender ID). He eventually admits he did it but can't remember why. No false suspects identified - Dalton appears actually guilty. Mistrial declared due to ADA misconduct, but double jeopardy prevents retrial. This is not a false accusation case.

Cory Banks (10) is initially suspected of molesting another boy (Patrick) during a sleepover. Investigation reveals Cory himself has been sexually abused. Wrestling coach Tony Acardo is arrested but proves innocent of molesting Cory. Cory's stepfather Thomas Banks is the actual abuser, having raped Cory for over a year and connected with pedophile organization leader Kevin O'Donnell. Coach Acardo is publicly arrested at wrestling practice in front of students, interrogated aggressively, and threatened with violence despite being innocent of the accusation.

Two bodies found in a truck, staged to look like cartel rape-murders. Investigation reveals victims were drug mule Ramona Rodriguez and cartel hitman Carlos Martinez. Eventually detectives discover Ramona's roommate Terri Banes, a CIA analyst, murdered them to retrieve classified intelligence. FBI Agent Porter helped stage the scene and cover up the murders as national security matter. All suspects in drug trafficking chain (supermarket contact, Manuel Rojas) were ultimately innocent of the murders - they were legitimate cartel/intelligence operatives doing their jobs. However, they were not publicly exposed or harmed by false accusations beyond standard investigative questioning.

A.J. Dunne, 16, is murdered in a motel by Ramsey Vickers, a sex addict she met on Craigslist. Before her death, therapist Martin Gold convinced A.J. she had 'repressed memories' of molestation by her father Greg Dunne—a fabricated claim that destroyed family relationships. Greg is publicly arrested at home in front of his wife for rape/murder (later cleared when alibi confirmed). Hotel clerk Richard is also initially suspected. Enzo, a teen patient, photoshops evidence to frame Gold. Episode exposes Gold's abusive 'therapy' program that kept teens dependent and manipulated.

Episode focuses on rape case against Sam Baylor (victim Nikki Sherman) where defense fabricates a recant statement to discredit prosecution. Parallel plot involves Detective Stabler's son Dickie going missing while searching for friend Shane Newsome, who is ultimately murdered by homeless man Harold Moore during robbery. No innocent persons are publicly accused or harmed by false sex crime accusations. Harold Moore confesses to murdering Shane for money/phone (not a sex crime). Sam Baylor is the actual rapist (guilty). Amy Wagner fabricated the recant claim as witness tampering, not as an accused person herself. No qualifying rows for dataset.

This episode centers on a bodega robbery that escalates into a hostage situation. ADA Carisi and several others are held at gunpoint by two armed robbers (Boyd Lynch and Deonte Mosley). During the crisis, clerk Ali Imran is shot and dies, and hostage Tess is sexually assaulted by Boyd. The episode does not feature anyone falsely accused of a sex crime who is later proven innocent. The perpetrators (Boyd and Deonte) are the actual offenders. No one meets the criteria for inclusion in person_rows.

Three children of undocumented immigrants are murdered by Joe Thagard, who claims he was brainwashed by radio host Gordon Garrison's anti-immigrant rhetoric. The episode follows SVU's investigation through multiple suspects before identifying Thagard. A delivery boy is wrongly accused and publicly questioned. Thagard is ultimately acquitted using a brainwashing defense, with his attorney Randall Carver arguing that hate media drove him to kill.

Anna McWilliams is raped and murdered in a park after using anonymous hookup app A.Q. Detectives initially suspect Peter Butler (her hookup partner) but he's cleared of murder via DNA. Actual killer is Henry Christensen, Anna's ex-boyfriend who followed her and killed her in jealous rage after she rejected him. Henry is publicly confronted at his prep school and arrested at home. Peter Butler is later prosecuted for knowingly spreading HIV to multiple women including Rebecca Ellison. Episode includes significant public exposure of Henry at school and police confrontation at family home.

Anne Gillette murders her parents for their inheritance. Detective Ash Ramsey is falsely accused of being a stalker/killer by Anne to divert suspicion. He is publicly arrested at a church with gun drawn in front of congregation. Anne also falsely claims he murdered her parents. The squad uses this to their advantage by having Ramsey work undercover to gather evidence against Anne. Anne later attempts to hire a hitman (actually undercover cop) to kill Ramsey and Benson, which provides evidence for her actual guilt.

After a woman is raped and murdered, the squad initially suspects Trey Greenway (a death metal artist/self-proclaimed vampire) due to evidence at the crime scene matching his music video. He is cleared via alibi. Later, victim's girlfriend Sharon Harris (an 'aggressive' lesbian with history of violence) is suspected and publicly confronted at a rally. She is cleared when another attack occurs while she's in custody. The actual rapist, Ronnie Whatley (print shop owner), is caught after attacking a second victim and confessing under interrogation.

Two prostitutes are murdered with religious prayer cards left on their bodies. Initial suspect Michael Gallagher is accused publicly of the murders based on DNA evidence linking him to victim Abby Mannion, but he is later cleared when prayer cards continue to appear after his arrest. The actual perpetrator is Billy Skaggs, a lay minister who attacks prostitutes while trying to 'save their souls.' Gallagher's exposure occurs at his home in front of his wife and children, with severe consequences to his marriage and reputation.

Episode centers on trial prep for Sir Toby Moore (media mogul rapist) which never proceeds due to his feigned heart attacks. Paul Davies, who previously beat a rape charge against Lakira (she recanted under pressure), is arrested for murdering Dakota Knight with strong DNA evidence. Davies was wrongly accused the first time (Lakira's recant implies coercion/error), but this time he's guilty. Subplot: Fin shoots Leon Fuller in self-defense while protecting Leon's son André; Joelle sues Fin for wrongful death. The episode focuses on witness intimidation, defense tactics delaying justice, and the toll on victims. Davies qualifies as previously falsely accused (Lakira recanted, charges dropped) but now guilty of different crime.

Lainie McCallum is raped at knifepoint in her building's stairwell by Bryce Kelton, a neighbor who claims it was consensual role-play. Nardelie Youla, a Congolese refugee and home health aide, witnesses the rape and intervenes. Bryce threatens Nardelie with deportation to silence her. Lainie dies from a staph infection contracted from her hand wound sustained during the rape. Bryce is convicted of rape but acquitted of murder. No false accusation or wrongful suspect scenario occurs—the accused rapist is actually guilty and convicted.

SVU investigates the rape of Cara Raleigh, a 41-year-old quadriplegic woman with aggressive MS who cannot speak. Initial investigation examines family members and caregivers. Sister Janice is arrested for assault (beating Cara with soap) and financial theft but is cleared of rape. Nephew Damien is briefly suspected but cleared. Bus driver Tony Griegs is identified as the rapist through fingerprint evidence on victim's diaper and victim's non-verbal identification. Two additional disabled victims (Beth Meyers, Julie Anderson) who cannot speak are discovered. Griegs falsely claims consensual relationship with Cara. Case goes to trial where Cara testifies non-verbally by blinking and pointing. No innocent persons are publicly accused or harmed by false accusations in this episode.

Jane Whitmore is murdered, initially appearing to be the work of the Bedtime Butcher serial killer from the 1970s. Ned Bogden is arrested and charged with being the Bedtime Butcher for 5 of 6 murders. However, Emily Cutler's 1976 murder (one of the six) was actually committed by former NYPD officer Susan Delzio, who was obsessed with Emily's husband Cal. Multiple women who had affairs with Cal (Jenny Coswold, Claire Lockton, Rita Wills) are investigated as suspects for Emily's murder before Delzio is revealed as the true killer. Bogden is proven guilty of the other murders but was innocent of Emily's death. The women suspects are cleared through investigation.

Jack Robinson murdered at wedding reception. Andrew Hingham (16) initially suspect. Andrew confesses to killing Jack in self-defense after attempted sexual assault. Investigation reveals Andrew's psychiatrist Dr. Stanton sexually abused him from age 13, falsely diagnosed schizophrenia to maintain control, committed him to hospital, and got pregnant by him. Multiple people falsely accused including: wedding godfather accused of murder (exposed at workplace), dishwasher accused of murder (interrogated), and Andrew falsely accused of raping Mallory Sidwell (which led to psychiatric hospitalization).

Laura Santiago, an undercover documentarian exposing unsafe conditions at a meat-processing plant, is raped and murdered. Multiple men are falsely accused: Jan Eyck (her vegan boyfriend) is publicly accused and interrogated; Jorge Vargas (coworker) is framed by his wife and arrested; and John Reilly (plant foreman) falsely confesses to protect his mother Rosa Doletti, the actual killer who wanted to protect the family business.

Frank Sullivan is arrested and charged with arson and murdering his two daughters (Kedzie and Faye) after a fire marshal concludes he set the fire for insurance money. Frank maintains his innocence, even attempting suicide to prove his sincerity. ADA Jo Marlowe becomes convinced of his innocence and, with the help of an independent fire expert, conducts a burn recreation that proves the fire was caused by an electrical short circuit, not arson. The case is dismissed. Michael Parisi ('Pizza Face'), a sex offender who molested Kedzie, initially confessed to the arson after coercive interrogation but was released when Frank became the primary suspect.

Episode involves baby trafficking ring targeting pregnant Bulgarian women. Donovan Black is arrested for rape but is separate from trafficking investigation. Glenn Butler falsely accused of domestic battery in his past (dismissed charge prevents adoption). Dr. Stephen Elroy involved in trafficking but coerced by threats. Focus is on Butler's false DV accusation and its lasting consequences preventing legitimate adoption.

A 16-year-old police 'wannabe' named Brad Fletcher impersonates an NYPD officer during a Central Park rapist task force operation. He successfully apprehends the actual rapist Wayne Hanket by conducting an illegal search that reveals Hanket's distinctive birthmark. Fletcher's status as a civilian minor and his illegal search methods initially jeopardize the case. While Fletcher faces charges for impersonation, he later provides critical evidence (discovery of rape videos at Hanket's home) that helps convict both Wayne Hanket and his father Travis Hanket (who orchestrated/encouraged the rapes). No innocent persons are falsely accused or publicly exposed in this episode—Wayne Hanket is the actual perpetrator throughout.

Nicholas Olsen is kidnapped and dies in a car crash during police pursuit. Mother Sophie Gerard is accused and publicly interrogated. Investigation reveals the father Paul Olsen hired the kidnapper using a credit card in Sophie's name to frame her. Sophie is innocent but suffers catastrophic psychological harm and public accusation before the truth emerges.

Mackenzie Burton stages her own kidnapping to reunite with her foster brother Wesley. Erik Weber, encountered at Grand Central, is initially suspected of being 'Eddie D' (an online predator) and arrested in front of crowds. Later cleared when revealed the real 'Eddie D' was Wesley, a child. The adoptive parents (Burtons) are also investigated for potential abuse after Mackenzie's note, though this doesn't result in formal accusation with public exposure. Dale Pinnington is arrested for the decade-old kidnapping/murder of Ella Burton (later found alive).

Two young girls (Rose and Mandy) are raped. The investigation initially focuses on registered sex offenders in the neighborhood. Edwin Adelson, a registered offender with priors, is arrested after images of the victims are found on his computer. He is publicly exposed, assaulted in custody by a police officer, arraigned, and commits suicide after being released on bail. However, it is later revealed that Erik Weber, a vigilante/community activist running a neighborhood watch group (COAP), planted the images on Adelson's computer. Weber is the actual rapist. Adelson was completely innocent of these crimes.

Vicki Sayers reports being raped by the same man four times over 15 years. She identifies Bill Harris, a surgical equipment sales rep, in a lineup. However, Harris has a solid alibi for the most recent attack (he was in Providence, RI). Despite Vicki's certainty and circumstantial evidence (storage locker with victim trophies, travel patterns matching other rapes), the case against Harris for the recent rape is dismissed due to degraded DNA. Detectives ultimately arrest Harris for kidnapping from a 1998 attack where he held Vicki hostage with duct tape for over 12 hours. The episode includes a subplot where detectives deliberately harass Harris publicly to pressure him, distributing flyers and confronting him at work and restaurants before having legal grounds to arrest him.

Episode centers on Carly Holbart (killed by taxi while fleeing captivity) and her brother Micah, both victims of human trafficking by Liam and Julie Ryan. Carly died from injuries sustained after being hit by a car; she had been starved and sexually assaulted. Micah pushed her into traffic, believing she was escaping and would cause the remaining captives to be punished. The Ryans were the actual perpetrators of forced labor, sexual slavery, and murder (previous victims in Florida). No innocent persons were falsely accused with public exposure or material consequences. Micah is treated as a victim throughout, not a suspect with public exposure. His father Patrick Holbart sent his children to what he believed was legitimate farm work, but was not publicly accused or exposed for wrongdoing. The episode focuses on rescuing trafficking victims and prosecuting the true perpetrators.

Lindsay Elding, a PR executive for a soda company, is found drowned in a fountain after being poisoned with South American mushrooms. The investigation initially focuses on Vincent Prochik, a mycology professor and water-rights activist who had confronted Lindsay at a fundraiser. Prochik confesses to the murder to gain a platform for his water-rights activism, but detectives discover he is innocent and was protecting Emma Brooks, a troubled young woman who actually committed the murder out of resentment toward Lindsay and her grandmother.

Bill Dixon and Victor Ramos are attacked and branded. Initially they claim not to know each other or their attacker. Investigation reveals Camille Walters attacked them in retaliation for gang-raping her 14 years earlier at summer camp when she was 14. Alexander Gammon was the third rapist who orchestrated the attack. The men lied about the assault and their connection. Ramos eventually confesses in court that all three raped Camille, validated by DNA proving he fathered her daughter conceived from the rape. No innocent persons were falsely accused - the 'victims' were actually perpetrators covering up their prior crime.

Episode focuses on capturing serial rapist Walter Burlock. Jason Gambel is his prison victim turned accomplice under extreme duress (beatings, rape). While Gambel is arrested and threatened with murder charges, he is ultimately portrayed as a victim of Burlock's control, not an innocent person falsely accused by police or the public. The harm to Gambel stems from Burlock's violence, not from a false accusation. No qualifying innocent persons are publicly accused and harmed as a consequence of that accusation.

FBI agent Dana Lewis is raped by Seth Coleman, a paroled sex offender who was hired by white supremacist Brian Ackerman (imprisoned by Dana years prior) as revenge. Coleman also rapes and murders Jennifer Briggs, an accountant who wrote to him as a prison pen pal. Coleman is caught and confesses to Jennifer's murder. Dana testifies at trial. No wrongfully accused individuals are identified in this episode—Coleman is guilty of both crimes, and no other suspects are seriously pursued then cleared.

Episode focuses on Chuck Mills, who is accused of rape by Bethany Jennings (disciplinary committee finds insufficient evidence) and later charged with causing abortion via misoprostol leading to Carla Vincent's death. No innocent persons are shown to suffer public exposure or material harm from false accusations. Chuck is ultimately arrested for manslaughter after Carla dies from toxic shock syndrome related to the misoprostol-induced miscarriage.

Caitlin Lamarck is found unconscious at a party after being shoved by Jill (the party host seeking revenge for Caitlin's published 'lay list'). She dies from head trauma. Paramedic Clark Tinta rapes her in the ambulance. SVU investigates multiple men from Caitlin's list who attended the party, all of whom are cleared. Mike O'Doole, Tinta's partner, is a thief who covers for Tinta's rapes. O'Doole is confronted publicly at work about theft and complicity. Tinta commits suicide when confronted. Parallel plot: Vivian Arliss's friend Sarah kills Vivian's rapist father Walter Burlock; later, Calvin's father David kills Sarah. Olivia loses custody of Calvin.

Ethan Gilbert, age 10, dies from a punctured lung after fighting Nicky Roberts in an illegal fight club run by adult men betting on their sons. Investigation reveals Hank Roberts (Nicky's stepfather) forced Nicky to fight other boys for money and beat Nicky when he lost. Hank is murdered; both Nicky and his mother Sandra separately confess to the killing. Episode explores child abuse and domestic violence but does not feature false accusations of sex crimes or public exposure of innocent parties. No qualifying person-rows as the central crimes are child abuse/endangerment/homicide, not sexual offenses, and there are no proven-innocent individuals publicly accused of sex crimes.

Orville Underwood was acquitted in 1996 for kidnapping and raping 10-year-old Larissa Welsh (known in abuse films as 'Brandy') due to lack of physical evidence despite victim testimony. After acquittal, community members repeatedly attacked him believing him guilty. He was beaten by Eldon Balogh during home invasion while Balogh searched for Larissa's identity. Years of public stigma and vigilante violence followed his acquittal despite his actual guilt being established by end of episode.

Episode involves serial rapist Brett Kincaid wearing a mask targeting women he wants to 'redeem.' Major subplot involves Dr. Cap Jackson, a sex addiction therapist, who believes he raped his daughter Ann 20 years ago in Falmouth. He confesses this to investigators and his therapy group. Later, Ann's childhood friend Linda reveals Cap actually had sex with her (Linda), not Ann—the sex was consensual, though Cap was drunk. Ann stopped talking to Cap because he slept with her first love (Linda), not because he assaulted Ann. Cap's false belief that he raped his daughter drove 20 years of estrangement and caused him to publicly confess to a crime he didn't commit.

ADA Page Ferguson is murdered after being falsely implicated in stealing drug money. Her colleague Detective Sunny Qadri orchestrated the murder through informant Damon Merced and his girlfriend Lakeisha Watkins to prevent Page from exposing the actual theft and from quitting her job. Multiple characters are falsely suspected including Angel Rivera (Latin Kings member), Detective Sean Riggs (Page's boyfriend), and informant Damon Merced before Sunny is revealed as the orchestrator.

A billionaire defense contractor, Jordan Hayes, is accused of raping a 12-year-old French model flown to NYC for his birthday. Hayes counters by filing a rape complaint against the girl, claiming she assaulted him. An innocent man on a plane (initially accused by a different victim returning from Hayes's party) is publicly confronted and humiliated. Hayes's ex-girlfriend Dahlia is exposed as a procurer but is also revealed to be a grooming victim herself. The episode explores power, wealth protecting predators, and the weaponization of accusations.

Gregory Engels orchestrates a fake kidnapping/rape to force SVU to investigate his brother Jason's 8-year-old cold case abduction. Multiple students at Westmore University are falsely suspected, including Carl Cooper (expelled student with matching tattoo) who is publicly arrested and questioned. The 'victim' Lizzie Harmon and accomplices Doug and other Phi Delta fraternity members staged the videos. Jason Engels was actually kidnapped by Miriam Penner, who replaced her deceased son with him.

Episode involves two distinct false accusation scenarios: (1) Scott Laskie wrongfully arrested based on doctored footage from vigilante TV show 'Neighborhood Predator' - accused publicly, suffered job/custody consequences despite trying to help a minor; (2) Donny Spencer briefly suspected of stalking but confessed only to threatening emails (not the serious stalking/murders). Primary plot involves serial killer Adam Grafton who murdered ADA Sonya Paxton and 40+ women over 25 years.

Ellen Sazelin's death initially appears to be rape/murder. Andreas (gallery owner/artist) is briefly suspected after tenant Maureen reports past assault attempt. Andreas is publicly questioned and humiliated despite having alibi. Investigation reveals Ellen's coworkers (Bruce, Corrine, David, Justin) conspired to silence her to protect lucrative company buyout. Bruce was sent to 'talk to Ellen' the night she died but claims she was already dead when he arrived. Ellen had secretly recorded videos of boss Annette Cole's abusive behavior and planned to expose it, threatening $500M buyout deal.

Jerry Bullard is stabbed outside a swingers club. The squad initially suspects Aldo (a homeless man with the victim's blood on his shirt) and then Doug Loveless (Cassandra's jealous ex-boyfriend who had confronted Jerry at the club). Both are later cleared. Aldo is proven innocent when he explains he encountered the victim after the attack. Doug is released when Jane Bullard (Jerry's wife) confesses to stabbing Jerry. However, Doug is later killed by Jerry in revenge after detectives reveal Doug and Cassandra are incestuous twins running a con. The episode contains two people who qualify under the rubric: Aldo (homeless witness) and Doug (falsely suspected boyfriend).

June Frye initially confesses to killing her student Marnie Foster, but it's revealed her half-sister Katie actually committed the crime. June covered for Katie out of guilt over not protecting her from their abusive mother. While June is briefly accused, she is never publicly exposed before the truth emerges. The investigation quickly identifies June based on evidence, and she voluntarily confesses (falsely) in a private hospital interrogation. No qualifying false suspects with public exposure or material harm.

Catherine Harrison reports being raped by an intruder. She first accuses Kevin Wright (her roommate's brother, a mentally ill man with a prior wrongful sex offender registration). After police find forensic evidence pointing away from Kevin, Catherine then accuses Dwight Talcott (a school cafeteria worker). Both men are innocent. The true crime: Dwight broke into Catherine's room and assaulted her (ripping clothes, climbing on her) but did NOT rape her. Catherine's grandfather—a former KKK member who raped Dwight's mother decades earlier—coached Catherine to falsely claim rape to ensure conviction. Two men publicly accused; one prior wrongful sex offender registration; both cleared.

Episode centers on Ken Turner, a reproductive abuser who fathers dozens of children through deceptive practices (poking holes in condoms). Wade Fisk is initially suspected of kidnapping/attempting to murder baby Jasper but is proven innocent - he took the baby to protect him. Wade is publicly accused in front of detectives and later at the precinct. Ken Turner is the primary antagonist but is eventually murdered by Dr. Audrey Shelton. The episode explores reproductive coercion and manipulation rather than traditional false rape accusations.

Hunter Mazelon, a 14-year-old arrested for burglary with intent to rape, falsely accuses Detective Elliot Stabler of molestation during booking. Hunter claims Stabler touched him inappropriately while uncuffing him in the youth office. The allegation is made publicly in open court at arraignment. Though the charge is ultimately dropped when Hunter pleads out to his original crimes, the false accusation temporarily threatens Stabler's career and causes him to be subjected to an Internal Affairs investigation. The episode reveals Hunter was himself molested as a child by his babysitter, which contributed to his becoming a serial rapist who ultimately murders his abuser.

Annette Fox, a rape victim set to testify against Luke Ronson, is murdered in what appears to be a purse snatching. Luke becomes the initial suspect after evidence is found at his home, but he is later proven innocent of the murder. Eddie Skinner, a career criminal hired by Luke to harass Annette, is revealed as the actual killer. Luke is cleared of murder but remains culpable for rape and witness tampering. Luke faces public confrontation at his salon by detectives and is arrested in front of clients, though ultimately cleared of the murder charge.

Roberto Distasio, a powerful Italian political figure and head of the Global Economic Trust, is accused of sexually assaulting hotel maid Miriam Deng. The case centers on the credibility of the victim, who is impeached by defense revelations that she lied on her asylum application and expressed interest in suing for money. Distasio is ultimately convicted only of unlawful imprisonment (lesser charge), with the jury hung on rape. No innocent persons are falsely accused in this episode - Distasio is the primary suspect throughout and is convicted of at least one charge. The victim's credibility is attacked but she maintains her accusation consistently. No red herrings or wrongly accused individuals meet the criteria for inclusion.

Basketball coach Ray Masters is accused of sexually abusing former players Stevie Harris and Prince Miller over many years. Stevie Harris comes forward, then dies of suspected foul play before trial. Prince Miller eventually testifies before a grand jury. No falsely accused persons are identified in this episode - the coach Ray Masters is the perpetrator throughout.

13-year-old Ella Mendez is found pregnant. Initially claims divine conception, then falsely accuses teacher Diego Ramirez (using assumed name Luis Cordova). Later reveals Tripp Raines raped her at a party. Tripp is murdered by Arturo Rivera, who is Tripp's half-brother (both fathered by Ambassador Andrew Raines). Diego/Luis faces wrongful accusation with public exposure at school.

Gabriel Thomas is wrongfully arrested and charged with serial rape based on DNA evidence. His identical twin brother Brian is the actual perpetrator who deliberately planted DNA and framed Gabriel. Gabriel is publicly arrested in front of his family, arraigned, remanded to Rikers, attempts suicide in custody, and is held for days before being cleared when Brian is caught in a sting operation.

A couple reports their baby stolen from their car on Halloween night. After extensive investigation and both parents confessing to killing the baby, the ME determines the infant died of SIDS (Sudden Infant Death Syndrome). The parents fabricated the carjacking story and falsely confessed to protect each other, but no one was actually accused of a crime they didn't commit - they voluntarily confessed to crimes that never occurred. No false suspects were pursued; the investigation focused solely on the parents who reported the crime.

Sarah Walsh accuses Michael Wedmore of rape at gunpoint. Michael is arrested, publicly exposed through court proceedings and family confrontation. He is acquitted on all charges (rape and gun possession), with defense establishing reasonable doubt through Sarah's one-night stand the night before and inconsistencies in her account. Michael is strongly implied innocent - his testimony is credible, no DNA evidence links him to rape, gun evidence is questionable (partner didn't see throw), and jury finds him not guilty. He suffered arrest, detention at Rikers, public trial, family exposure, and community stigma.

A Russian mail-order bride scam involves women luring wealthy men, faking kidnappings, and murdering unrelated prostitutes to make it appear the bride was killed. Daniel Carter, a nonprofit director, was targeted and lost his life savings believing his fiancée Lena was kidnapped and murdered. Lena claimed she was forced by Russian mobster Liev Bodrov who controlled her by allegedly holding her daughter hostage. Captain Cragen went undercover to catch Lena. The episode reveals Lena's daughter had actually been murdered four years prior, and Lena was an active participant in the criminal operation, ultimately shooting a police officer. Daniel was deceived but never formally accused of a crime - he was a victim of the scam, not suspected of murder.

Darren Bickford, a public lewdness suspect, witnesses a rape at LaGuardia psychiatric hospital and reports it. Jay Delaney, another patient, is briefly suspected but was protecting the victim. Security guard Charles Lee is accused but claims consensual encounter. The actual perpetrator is George Zane, the victim's uncle who groomed and abused her for 10 years. Both Darren (the witness) and Jay (the protective patient) experienced public accusations/confrontations that caused harm despite being innocent of sexual crimes.

Marc Rajic, a developmentally disabled Romani man, is falsely accused of murdering 10-year-old Nico Grey. He is publicly identified by schoolgirls who actually committed the crime, hidden by his community, hunted by police, and faces neighborhood/community threats. He is later cleared when the real perpetrators (Courtney and Emma) confess. The episode demonstrates harm through police pursuit, community fear/anger, and near-vigilante violence by Nico's mother.

Episode involves a 14-year-old runaway sex-trafficked by a pimp. Police conduct a sting operation arresting multiple Johns, including former NFL quarterback Jake Stanton. Stanton is revealed to be suffering from CTE (chronic traumatic encephalopathy) causing severe cognitive decline. He is found not guilty due to diminished capacity but commits suicide at the end. The episode also depicts the teenage victim, Vicki Harris, who is arrested (as a tactic to remove her from the trafficking situation) but is treated as a victim throughout.

Multiple innocent parties falsely accused/exposed: Jason Roberts (stalker with cameras but didn't commit rape), Judge Gerald Crane (tricked into believing encounter was consensual fantasy), Ted Scott (director falsely accused by detectives of orchestrating the setup). Judge Crane publicly confessed to rape before learning he was deceived. Jason arrested on surveillance charges. Ted questioned as suspect.
