Maddie's mother Eileen, traumatized by the process, confronts Brouchard with an unloaded gun but is talked down by Benson. Brouchard is ultimately convicted on all charges. No innocent persons were falsely accused in this episode - the focus is on the guilty defendant and the victims/family trauma.

SVU investigates a serial rapist (Leon Wallace) who targets brides-to-be the night before their weddings. The case involves three victims: Jenna (who reported at her wedding), Darcy Hamlin (six months prior, Brooklyn), and Breena Richards (one year prior, never officially reported until this case). Leon Wallace, a maintenance worker at a flower wholesaler, is identified through DNA evidence from rape kits and matching patterns. He is arrested after Detective Rollins conducts an undercover operation where she poses as a bride-to-be and obtains his DNA. Wallace ultimately confesses and accepts a plea deal. No innocent persons were falsely accused or publicly exposed in this episode. The investigation followed evidence from rape kits and witness identification directly to the actual perpetrator.

SVU investigates a series of cold case abductions/murders spanning decades. Cal Markham falsely confesses to murdering his cousin Gwen to force police to exhume her body and find real evidence. He is arrested, publicly processed, and held at Brooklyn House of Detention before being cleared when DNA evidence excludes him and identifies the true killer, Richard Kincaid.

Billy Hedges, a sanitation worker, is wrongly arrested and charged for a serial rape case (the 'Wire Hanger Rapist'). He is identified by victim Ariel Bradford and his fingerprint is found at her apartment. He pleads guilty under pressure from his public defender, accepting a 7-year minimum sentence. While he is in custody, another attack occurs with the same MO, proving his innocence. The real perpetrator, Glenn Duncan (ex-Marine), is eventually caught. Hedges is released, but only after spending time in Rikers and being publicly accused. His teenage son Toby is so traumatized by his father's wrongful imprisonment that he confronts Fin with a gun (accidentally shooting him). The case was rushed by new ADA Heidi Russell who resisted admitting the mistake even after new evidence emerged.

Four University of New York pre-law students are victims of a home invasion resulting in one murder (Shelli), one rape (Elodie), and two assaults. Initial suspect Teddy Hall is publicly questioned and cleared via alibi. Sam Ellis, who had unrequited feelings for victim Shelli and installed a hidden camera in her room, is ultimately convicted after a confession on the stand.

Maggie Andrews discovers her stepfather Judge Leonard Andrews' diary describing sexual abuse of an eight-year-old stepdaughter. She reports to SVU, recovers memories of childhood abuse, and the case goes to trial. Judge Andrews is convicted and pleads guilty to seven years. No innocent parties are falsely accused or publicly exposed in this episode - the accused is proven guilty.

An Albanian robbery crew breaks into James and Nora Fletcher's home during their anniversary party. One crew member, Aldrit Neziri, rapes Nora in front of her husband and friends. The crew was set up by James's business manager, Dennis Maynard, who embezzled $10 million in gold. All perpetrators are arrested and convicted. No innocent persons are falsely accused in this episode—all suspects are guilty of their respective crimes.

Episode focuses on two sexual assault cases involving teenagers and choking during sex influenced by pornography. Ryan Blake (16) injures his girlfriend Hannah during their first sexual encounter, choking her and causing a concussion. His younger cousin Andrew and friend Toby (both 13) assault Eliza Quinn (12) with choking, causing her to run into traffic where she is killed. Investigation reveals Ryan's father Josh Blake showed him pornography and gave him inappropriate advice. Josh is arrested for child endangerment. No false accusations or wrongly suspected persons depicted in this episode.

Episode involves a sextortion ring led by Basil and Constantine Koutris who targeted victims through dating apps and online forums. Neil Marsh was forced to work as an accomplice after being victimized himself. Tyler Camden was hired to seduce victims and secretly record them. Reporter Kelsey Sommers and Ruby Conzo were among the victims. All perpetrators were arrested and charged. No one was falsely accused of committing sexual crimes - the victims were genuine victims of sextortion, and the perpetrators (Constantine, Basil, Tyler, Neil) were actually involved in the scheme to varying degrees. Neil was both victim and accomplice but was not innocent of participation. This episode does not contain false accusations of sexual crimes against innocent people.

Chris Becker fabricates a story about a 'dirty mountain man' attacker to deflect from his own assault on girlfriend Ellie Hughes. A bartender (Danny) is also briefly suspected and arrested for spitting on Ellie. Both the fictional mountain man narrative and Danny's involvement represent false accusations, though only Danny faces real-world consequences (arrest for assault via spitting). The episode demonstrates how an actual perpetrator can weaponize false accusations to obscure their guilt.

Episode features one person (Timothy Cottle) who qualifies as falsely accused with public exposure. Cottle is a substitute teacher whom ADA Carisi suspects of pedophilic intentions based on observing him looking at Carisi's 9-year-old daughter. Carisi investigates Cottle's employment history, discovers an old unsubstantiated complaint about 'ick vibes' from a parent, and contacts HR/school administrators. This investigation results in Cottle being fired from his teaching position. Cottle confronts Carisi, stating he has never acted on his attractions to minors and asks for help. Episode ends with Cottle entering behavioral therapy. No evidence of actual crime is presented. Miguel Rivera is the actual rapist and is proven guilty.

ADA Carisi and others are held hostage during a deli robbery. One robber (Boyd) sexually assaults hostage Tess. Ali (deli clerk) is shot and killed. No false accusations of sex crimes occur; the perpetrator Boyd is caught in the act. Deonte (accomplice) helps stop Boyd but is arrested for accomplice liability. This episode does not contain wrongful accusations of sexual offenses—it depicts an actual sexual assault during a violent robbery.

Harris Vernon drugged his wife and arranged for other men to assault her. Tommy Gallagher and Derek Poole were initially treated as suspects/perpetrators but were themselves manipulated victims. Tommy was publicly arrested at work in front of colleagues. Derek participated once, felt guilty, and testified against Harris. Both men were initially accused of rape before the full manipulation scheme was revealed.

Anthony Reed, a 16-year-old boy in foster care, is found at a motel with a dead man (Colin Clark) and a gun. Initially claims self-defense and kidnapping, but investigation reveals he was being sex-trafficked by his CPS caseworker Michael Strickland. Strickland forced Anthony to shoot Colin (who was trying to help Anthony escape trafficking) by putting his hand over Anthony's on the trigger. No innocent person was falsely accused in this episode - Colin Clark was actually trying to help Anthony, but was not formally accused of a crime before being murdered. Michael Strickland is the actual perpetrator.

Kyra Thompson, a young insurance sales assistant, is sexually assaulted by client Jim Hogan during a business meeting orchestrated by her boss Frank Bailey. Bailey coerced Kyra into the situation by threatening to report her for lost company cash. The case focuses on prosecuting both Hogan (for sexual assault) and Bailey (for sexual coercion as an accomplice). Jim Hogan is accused and arrested for sexual assault, and his DNA confirms the assault occurred. He is guilty of the crime he was accused of. Frank Bailey is accused and arrested for sexual coercion; he is also guilty. No innocent persons are accused and publicly exposed in this episode.

Adam Parker, a college admissions advisor, created fake social media profiles to trick wealthy high school students into sending nude photos, which he then sold to pedophiles. Matthew Daly, a special-needs 32-year-old with the cognition of a fifth-grader, was entrapped by Detective Silva posing as a 14-year-old girl on the gaming platform Wish Crafter. Matthew was arrested, booked, held overnight with actual pedophiles, and arraigned on attempted rape charges before Captain Benson intervened to get the charges dismissed. The case was completely dropped after recognizing Matthew's innocence and cognitive disability.

A 17-year-old girl is raped and a boy tied up in Highbridge Park. A sketch artist creates a composite based on the victim's description. Community vigilantes led by Danny Rocha (Velasco's neighbor) beat up Eddie Soto, who resembles the sketch. Soto is arrested but later cleared when the rape kit DNA doesn't match and the victims don't ID him in a lineup. The actual rapist, James Aquino, is later caught. Eddie Soto suffered public exposure when confronted by vigilantes in the street, was hospitalized with a concussion, and arrested by police.

Megan Wallace, a tourist from Iowa, is raped in Times Square by wine rep Gerard Ridley. The episode follows her case through trial where defense attempts to portray the encounter as consensual, exploiting her MS diagnosis. Ridley is convicted. No false suspect scenario present—the actual perpetrator is identified, arrested, and convicted. While the defense makes accusations against the victim, she is not a suspect herself, and no innocent third party is publicly accused of the crime.

Ryan Perry (16) meets Stacey Moran (28) at a hotel bar during his father's wedding. They drink together and have sex in the hotel pool/hot tub. Ryan's stepmother finds Stacey's underwear in his tux and files a statutory rape report. Stacey is arrested, arraigned, and publicly accused. She claims she was drugged with MDMA that Ryan put in vodka without her knowledge and that she was incapacitated/taken advantage of. Evidence shows Ryan texted friends about wanting to 'tag' older women that night. Case goes to trial; jury deadlocks and mistrial is declared. Stacey faces devastating public exposure: arrested, arraigned in open court with both families present, faces registry threat, marriage crisis, and career jeopardy as a teacher.

Ellie Hughes, a comatose influencer in long-term care after being attacked by her ex-boyfriend Chris Becker, is discovered to be pregnant. The investigation requires DNA testing to determine if the father is Chris or someone who assaulted her while comatose. SVU collects DNA samples from 115+ male hospital employees, multiple visitors, and eventually identifies youth pastor Caleb Hartwell as the perpetrator. While many individuals were briefly considered as potential suspects and required to provide DNA samples, the episode contains minimal public exposure or lasting harm to innocent parties. Hospital staff cooperated voluntarily with DNA collection as part of a systematic investigation rather than being publicly accused.

This episode centers on the prosecution of Deonte Mosley for his role as an accomplice in a deli hostage situation where a clerk was murdered and a woman (Tess Milburn) was raped by Boyd Lynch. While defense argues Mosley acted under duress and ultimately killed Lynch in self-defense, prosecution argues he was a willing participant who killed his accomplice to avoid testimony. ADA Carisi, who was a hostage during the incident, testifies but has an outburst in court. Mosley is ultimately convicted of robbery and two counts of murder but acquitted of rape. NO false accusations or wrongly accused individuals are present in this episode - Mosley was an actual participant in the crimes, and the legal question is about the degree of his culpability and whether killing Lynch was justified self-defense.

Eddie Upshaw is found assaulted with '6-15-2001' carved on his back. Initial suspect is apprentice Sam Carson, who had workplace conflict with Eddie and lied about his alibi. Sam is questioned publicly with his father present before revealing he was a victim of Eddie's abuse. Investigation reveals Eddie was acquitted in 2004 trial for sexually abusing 8-year-old Angela Jones in 2001. Angela, recently released from prison, confesses to attacking Eddie. Sam was cleared as suspect but publicly questioned and his abuse became known to his parents through police interview.

SVU investigates murders of women from shelters, initially suspecting Miguel Pinto (DNA planted by actual killer). Father Alberto flees when questioned, resulting in shooting where Lieutenant Paul Gomez (Maria's supervisor) shoots himself while struggling for control of weapon. Investigation reveals Gomez was the serial rapist/killer, framing innocent people and threatening witnesses. Miguel Pinto was wrongfully accused with planted DNA evidence. Father Alberto was threatened and fled police in terror before being killed in struggle with Gomez.

8-year-old Haley Greene is kidnapped from her mother's car by Nicole and Dennis Carwood, a couple who operate an online torture site. The Carwoods had previously abused and killed their own daughter Ashlynn. Police rescue Haley alive. No false suspects or innocent parties publicly accused. The perpetrators are identified through investigative leads (dog breed acoustics, breeder networks) rather than wrongful accusations.

A witness reports seeing a sexual assault through a telescope. Investigation reveals siblings Josie (18) and Atlas (17) were forced at gunpoint to have sex with each other on camera. Initially appears to be kidnapping/ransom scheme. Derek Rhodes (Atlas's biological father) is investigated due to prior arrest for exploitation photos and pending alimony cut-off. Atlas violently attacks Derek with baseball bat, hospitalizing him. Investigation reveals Atlas orchestrated entire scheme with gaming friend Jaden Thomas to sexually assault his stepsister Josie before she left for college. Derek was innocent of any involvement in the kidnapping/assault.

Dr. Gretchen Stewart is raped and assaulted in her office. Anthony Fierro, a patient with DV history and ketamine paranoia, is initially suspected. SVU confronts him on a highway; he pulls a gun and commits suicide. Later investigation reveals he was at his hotel during the attack (confirmed by surveillance and receipts). The actual perpetrator is Ted Schramm, who attacked three therapists. Fierro's wife had taken out a restraining order after couples therapy with Dr. Stewart helped her leave him.

Episode centers on the rape of Ella Parsons in a MetroBnB apartment owned by Eric Burnett, who is arrested and prosecuted. Key witness Jorge Ruíz faces ICE detention but ultimately testifies. Parallel plot involves Fin being assaulted and losing his gun. Eric Burnett is arrested and prosecuted but there is no evidence he is innocent - he gave false alibi and was identified leaving the scene. Jorge Ruíz is threatened with deportation for cooperating but is not accused of the sex crime. No false suspects are identified or publicly exposed for sex crimes in this episode.

SVU investigates a sex club called Sensate where members sign consent waivers. The case involves sex trafficking, drug distribution, and sexual assault. No false accusations are present - the investigation correctly identifies Derek Simpson as running a criminal enterprise involving drugged and coerced women. Maya Moretti is a legitimate victim who initially resisted cooperating due to shame but ultimately testified. Isabella Cruz and other women were trafficked victims, not falsely accused perpetrators. The episode focuses on prosecuting the actual guilty party (Simpson) rather than wrongfully accusing innocents.

SVU investigates a fertility clinic bombing that destroys evidence in a rape case. Dr. Ila Mukherjee is found murdered. Initial suspects include rape suspect Ted Simons, antinatalist activist Kirk Young, and the victim's estranged husband Chris Clemente. All are cleared. The actual killer is revealed to be Mark Olson, Mukherjee's own divorce lawyer, who killed her to prevent being exposed for malpractice and to collect on fraudulent liens.
